lang.#text: WiDom Universal Roller Shutter is a blind control designed for being installed behind a standard switch. WiDOM Universal Roller Shutter is an Motor Control with auto calibration and self recovering position capabilities.
Start normal Inclusion by pressing the (B) button once or three times or alternatively by pressing the external switch once.
Group 5: devices that will be controlled by hold on the external switch
Group 4: devices that will be controlled by a triple click on the external switch
Group 3: devices that will be controlled by a double click on the external switch
Group 2: devices that will be controlled by a single click on the external switch
Group 1: devices that will be notified of changes in its status
Enables\Disables the shutter's control trough the external Switch

0 – SWITCH DISABLED
1 – SWITCH ENABLED
Favourite level for position ON
From: 50 (50%) to 100 (100% - FULL ON)
Favourite level for position OFF
From: 0 (OFF) to 49 (49%)
Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 1 click

1 – LIKE THE STATUS: Actions on the button ON -  Basic Set ON_LEVEL;  Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
2 – IGNORE IF ON: Actions on the button ON - No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL 
3 – IGNORE IF OFF: Actions on the button ON -  No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
4 – IGNORE: Actions on the button ON -  No action
Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 2 clicks

1 – LIKE THE STATUS: Actions on the button ON -  Basic Set ON_LEVEL;  Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
2 – IGNORE IF ON: Actions on the button ON - No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL 
3 – IGNORE IF OFF: Actions on the button ON -  No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
4 – IGNORE: Actions on the button ON -  No action
Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 3 clicks

1 – LIKE THE STATUS: Actions on the button ON -  Basic Set ON_LEVEL;  Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
2 – IGNORE IF ON: Actions on the button ON - No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL 
3 – IGNORE IF OFF: Actions on the button ON -  No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
4 – IGNORE: Actions on the button ON -  No action
Action on the associated devices when the external switch is hold

1 – LIKE THE STATUS: Actions on the button ON -  Basic Set ON_LEVEL;  Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
2 – IGNORE IF ON: Actions on the button ON - No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL 
3 – IGNORE IF OFF: Actions on the button ON -  No action; Actions on the button OFF -  Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
4 – IGNORE: Actions on the button ON -  No action
Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set

1 – AS RECEIVED (Default value): ON - ON; OFF - OFF
 2 – IGNORE IF ON: ON - Maintains the initial status; OFF - OFF 
3 – IGNORE IF OFF: ON - ON; OFF - Maintains the initial status 
4 – IGNORE: Maintains the initial status and, if the programmed switch-off timer is active, it is restarted.
ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 2

Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands.
The following values can be used to configure parameters 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36 and 37.
From: 1 (OFF) - to 99 (ON) for diming purpose - 0 and 255(0xFF) for switching ON\OFF.
Default value 255(0xFF) – ON
OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 2
Default value 0 – OFF
ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 3
Default value 255(0xFF) – ON
OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 3
Default value 0 – OFF
ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 4
Default value 255(0xFF) – ON
OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 4
Default value 0 – OFF
ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 5
Default value 255(0xFF) – ON
OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 5
Default value 0 – OFF
Smoke Alarm, CO, CO2 Action (1 byte) - Defines how the device reacts when it receives one of the following types of alarms: smoke, CO and CO2.

1 – ON: The device status switches to ON 
2 – OFF: The device status switches to OFF 
4 – IGNORE: The alarm will be ignored
Heat Alarm (1 byte) - Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Heat Alarm

1 – ON: The device status switches to ON 
2 – OFF: The device status switches to OFF 
4 – IGNORE: The alarm will be ignored
Water Alarm (1 byte) - Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Water Alarm

1 – ON: The device status switches to ON 
2 – OFF: The device status switches to OFF 
4 – IGNORE: The alarm will be ignored
Home Security (1 byte) - Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Home Security Alarm.

1 – ON: The device status switches to ON 
2 – OFF: The device status switches to OFF 
4 – IGNORE: The alarm will be ignored
Calibration (1 byte) - Starts the system's calibration by setting the parameter's value as final level

From: 0 (0%) to 100 (100%)
During the calibration phase the parameter’s value is set to 1 and it is restored to the default value at the end of the procedure.
Configuration Reset (1 byte) - Defines what are the parameters to be restored to default values.

0 – FACTORY RESET: The original manufacturer configuration is restored within the device.
1 – ASSOCIATIONS RESET: All and only the associations are reset 
2 – CONFIGURATIONS RESET: The associations are maintained while all other configuration parameters are reset to the manufacturer's original settings, except for this specific configuration.
4 – IGNORE (Default value): No action is carried out
Protection time

Represents to maximum time allowed to complete a run (from completely open to completely closed). After that time the relay contacts are opened.
From: 0 to 127 Seconds –
Default value: 60 Seconds
Inversion of commands UP\DOWN

Inverts the outputs controlling the motor. Once the inversion is enabled, the receipt of an opening/closure command will make the motor move in the opposite direction compared to what happens when the parameter is set on 0.
WARNING: The inversion of commands starts the calibration procedure requiring the system to completely run twice, from being completely open to completely closed.
0 – DISABLED
1 – ENABLED
Learn Mode

efines the sequence of clicks on the external switch to be associated with the Learning Mode status.
0 – DISABLED
1 – 1 CLICK
2 – 2 CLICK
3 – 3 CLICK
INFO: When Learning mode is associated to a click event any configuration related to the associated devices is ignored. The configuration is valid for a single event. After which the default value will be restored (0 – DISABLED).
